main event: On December 7, 1958, two lights were observed in the sky over Omaha, Nebraska, one flashing and the other steady.
interesting points: The flashing light approached within 30 degrees of the horizon before descending and disappearing., The steady light continued on a straight course at a similar altitude and speed., The height and speed of the objects could not be determined., The flashing light appeared to be under intelligent control., No radar contact was established during the observation.
witness description: two civilian observers (a housewife and a high school student) and a military observer
